events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred on a rainy evening, causing damage to the front bumper and left headlight of the vehicle.
After reviewing the initial report, the claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to visible vehicle collision and damages sustained.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case promptly to ensure clear communication and timely assistance to the customer.
The claim was formally acknowledged, and the customer was informed about the next steps in the claims process.
The customer was requested to submit photos of the damaged vehicle parts, a police report, and a copy of the driving license.
The customer submitted all required documents, including photos and an official police report, facilitating the claim investigation.
A claims investigator was assigned to examine the submitted evidence and verify the conditions surrounding the vehicle collision.
The investigation confirmed the accident circumstances and damage extent, supporting the validity of the customer's claim.
A settlement offer was prepared based on repair costs and policy coverage, and was communicated to the customer for review.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the timely updates throughout the process.
Following customer agreement, the claim was officially approved to proceed with the payment and repair arrangements.
The insurance payment was issued promptly to the customerâ€™s account to cover authorized repairs of their vehicle.
The claim case was closed after confirming the customer had completed repair work and was satisfied with the resolution.
All claim documents and correspondence have been archived for future reference in compliance with company policy.
